title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Friday, 11 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: babysitting couple jailed for abuse of toddler .
cambridge city council rejects devolution plan - but county council signs up .
five flood warnings are in place across cambridgeshire and flood gates are closed across two roads .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from our live page for the week .
have a great weekend and do join us again on monday , when well be back from 08:00 .
do n't forget - you can get involved with our live page at any time .
send us your stories and by email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: 'great bravery ' of man who tackled a knife-wielding robber praised by judge
text: a witness who tackled a knife-wielding robber to the ground has been praised by a judge and awarded £ 500 .
the man intervened after russell ebbage , 33 , from patterdale drive , gunthorpe in peterborough , robbed the shopping basket in paston on 29 january and stole £ 1,000 in cash .
cambridgeshire police said ebbage got away from the witness , but left behind his knife which was handed in .
the force arrested ebbage two days later .
he was jailed for 2 years and 8 months at peterborough crown court .

documents.title: flood alert issued for the ouse washes
text: the environment agency has issued a flood alert for the ouse washes after a month 's worth of rain fell during 12 hours on tuesday night into wednesday .
officials will also be monitoring the situation at the a1101 welney causeway , in case that road needs to close .
the agency is asking people to visit their website for further details - and say it will be updated every 15 minutes .

documents.title: weather : staying dry but some dense fog expected in the early hours
text: it should stay dry tonight but there is a warning for some dense fog early on saturday morning .
minimum temperature : -2c ( 30f ) .
once the early mist has cleared , saturday will be dry with maximum temperatures of 11c ( 50f ) .
for a more detailed forecast for where you live head to bbc weather .
author: Chris Bell
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: provisional republic of ireland squad names posh midfielder forrester
text: peterborough united midfielder chris forrester has been named in the provisional republic of ireland squad for the friendlies against switzerland and slovakia later this month .
the squad is set to be trimmed before 20 march - if forrester does make the cut , he 'll miss posh 's good friday clash with coventry .
forrester has been one of posh 's stand out-players this season .
having signed from st patrick 's in september , he 's chipped in with two goals .
author: Nick Fairbairn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: headlines : peterborough couple 's sexual assault on girl 'worst judge has seen ' government to press ahead with eastern devolution
text: these are the stories we 're leading with this afternoon :
author: Sara Varey
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: east anglian devolution : 'any deal needs to be right for the area ' says south cambs leader
text: more reaction is coming in from cambridgeshire council leaders to government plans for an `` eastern powerhouse '' devolved government .
south cambridgeshire district council leader ray manning has pointed out `` no deal has yet been signed '' and there are lengthy negotiations ahead .
he added : `` any deal will need to be the right thing for the area now and in the future and we are very much at the table . ''
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: cambridge university pembroke around the world in 80 days party 'racist '
text: a cambridge university student party has been halted in a row over political correctness after concerns it had `` potential for offence '' .
pembroke college students were expecting to attend a fancy dress party based on jules verne 's novel around the world in 80 days .
a student committee decided it might lead to `` cultural appropriation '' if students dressed in clothes de other races , as the tab reported .
the university did not comment .

documents.title: fuel poverty in rural homes in eye and thorney to be tackled with new heating systems
text: a national fuel poverty charity has given a grant of £ 145,000 to peterborough city council to install innovative fuel and heating systems in homes in eye and thorney .
the city council says the areas have `` higher than average statistics for fuel poverty compared to other areas in peterborough '' .
the national energy action money will be spent on 45 properties in the villages .

documents.title: campaign to raise funds for a statue of posh legend chris turner reaches £ 35,000
text: a fundraising campaign to erect a statue of cambridgeshire football legend chris turner has almost reached the halfway point .
adi moles , a member of the fund 's committee , says they 've raised £ 35,000 towards the £ 80,000 needed .
turner played for and managed both peterborough united and cambridge united and died in april after a long battle with dementia .

documents.title: cambridge university explorers : naked natives and frozen sausages
text: naked natives and freeze-dried sausages feature in an exhibition chronicling a cambridge college 's `` enduring fascination '' with exploration .
photographs and maps , some of which have never gone on public display , have been found in the st john 's college archive .
organisers of the exhibition say the college has an `` enduring fascination with exploration which seems to have begun in the 1600s '' .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: weather : sunny spells may break through the cloudy afternoon
text: the best of the sunny spells this afternoon should be in the peterborough area , which is good news for bbc weather watcher paul 's patch - who took this photo in longthorpe .
feeling slightly cooler than yesterday although winds remaining light through the day .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: jailed couple 's abuse of baby 'worst i 've seen ' says judge
text: the judge who jailed a couple who sexually assaulted a 13-month-old toddler described their actions as `` the worst abuse of a baby '' he 'd seen .
lara chase , 46 , and her husband michael , 52 , were sentenced to 13 and 14 years respectively at peterborough crown court .
the assaults took place over a two-year period , while the couple were babysitting the girl .
author: Louise Hubball
BBC Look East

documents.title: headlines : peterborough babysitters jailed for sexually assaulting toddler cambridge city council rejects government 's plans for a devolved east anglian super authority
text: here are the stories we 're leading with today :
author: Sara Varey
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: babysitters from peterborough jailed for sexually assaulting toddler
text: two babysitters who sexually assaulted a toddler in their care have been jailed at peterborough crown court .
michael chase , 52 , and his wife lara , 46 , both from bathurst in peterborough , were sentenced to 14 and 13 years respectively .
the court heard the girl was 13 months old when the abuse began .
author: Alex Harris
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: cambridgeshire county council : devolution deal is 'right thing for the communities we serve '
text: while cambridge city council has rejected the government 's plan for an east anglian super authority - the county council has signed up .

leader steve count says : `` by signing this agreement we are giving the opportunity for all our councillors to debate whether the proposed deal put forward by government is the right thing for the communities we serve . ''
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: trees pollarded at fowlmere reserve to help wildlife and insects
text: it receives 20,000 visitors a year and it 's a site of special scientific interest , but to keep it that way , rspb fowlmere needs regular maintenance .
six willow large trees have been pollarded , a traditional tree management system which removes the lower branches of a tree to encourage new growth in the tree 's crown .

the work , which has been funded by a £ 650 grant from south cambridgeshire district council , provides high growth for nesting birds , while the willow branches will rot down and offer homes and food for insects .
author: Katy Prickett
BBC News

documents.title: devolution : what does it mean ?
text: in essence , it 's the power to run more of our own services here in the east - instead of the westminster government taking these decisions .

this means local politicians based in norfolk , suffolk or cambridgeshire could be the ones to take control of things like transport , planning , health services , flood defences and further education .
but to do so , the government thinks we should form a super local authority - made up of norfolk , suffolk and cambridgeshire county councils , as well as the region 's city and district councils .
author: Deborah McGurran
BBC Political editor, East of England

documents.title: government 'likely to go ahead ' with eastern powerhouse devolution
text: i understand the government is likely to go ahead with an eastern powerhouse devolution deal , despite the fact that cambridge city council has decided not to take part .
their view is that one council 's decision to turn down the offer is not a barrier to a deal being agreed with the remaining 22 councils .
more details on bbc look east at 13:30 .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: cambridge leader lewis herbert says government 's devolution plans are 'rushed '
text: government proposals to create an east anglian super authority have been described as `` rushed '' and `` not the right deal for cambridge '' by the city 's council leader lewis herbert .

norfolk and suffolk county councils favour the deal - but mr herbert claims they 've had months to look at `` the complex proposals '' , while councils in cambridgeshire `` have only had a few days '' .
he said the city council 's one `` ask '' - for funding to replace council houses sold off under right to buy - had been rejected by the government .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: east cambridgeshire district council leader says he 'd choose devolution
text: james palmer says he 'd sign up for a devolved local government for east anglia .
the leader of east cambridgeshire district council - which covers ely - has told bbc radio cambridgeshire 's paul stainton show he wants a share of the £ 1.2bn of government money .
cambridge city council has just announced it would turn down the devolution deal , but norfolk and suffolk county councils are keen to take it up .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: taxpayers in peterborough may foot bill in battle over two cinemas
text: the battle between two companies to build rival cinema-led developments in peterborough has taken a potentially drawn out legal twist that could leave council taxpayers footing the bill .
tax payers in # peterborough may foot bill in battle over two cinemas - read more : # cmblive
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: police warn that whittlesey flood gate is damaged but road remains closed
text: the b1040 near whittlesey remains closed , police have tweeted
# eastdeplh # whittlesey .
road is closed .
flood gate has been damaged however the road remains closed due to flooding .

documents.title: cambridge city council joins county council in turning down devolution deal
text: cambridge city council has just confirmed to me it has rejected the government 's offer of a devolution deal .
the council says it is willing to carry on speaking to ministers and other local authorities about working together , but the offer on the table does n't meet its demands .
norfolk and suffolk are keen to join forces in a devolved local government - but cambridgeshire county council had previously rejected the offer .
author: Tom Barton
BBC Look East political reporter

documents.title: breakinggovernment 's devolution deal rejected by cambridge authority
text: it 's emerged cambridge city council has rejected the government 's offer of a devolution deal .
more to follow .

documents.title: road accidents on a47 , a14 and in peterborough
text: police have been dealing with three road accidents in cambridgeshire this morning .
two lorries were involved in an accident on the a1 alconbury- spittals interchange link road , which has been closed while recovery takes place .
three vehicles collided on the a47 thorney bypass , with one ending up in a ditch .
the westbound carriageway of the frank perkins parkway in peterborough was after a collision about half a mile from the boongate roundabout .
for the latest , visit bbc travel .

documents.title: fire service says there may be cultural explanation for rubbish fires
text: cambridgeshire fire service says there may be a cultural explanation for the number of refuse fires doubling in the past year .
the service said 70 % of deliberate fires were taking place in ethnically-diverse peterborough .
group commander kevin napier said : `` the areas in peterborough where we 're seeing these spikes are where we do have a multi-cultural society . ''

documents.title: travel : a14 blocked southbound after accident
text: a crash has blocked the southbound a14 between the a1 ( m ) junction at alconbury to junction 23 for the a141 ( huntingdon ) .
check the latest travel news here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: flood warnings : flood gates closed in places
text: seven flood warnings are in place across cambridgeshire , including around kimbolton , whittlesey , ramsey and brampton .
flood gates have been closed on mill lane in little paxton and the b1040 north bank and east delph road in whittlesey .

however , reports have been made to bbc radio cambridgeshire that only the gate at one end of the b1040 has been closed , leaving motorists passing the open gate and finding their way blocked by the closed gate .
for the latest flood warnings , visit the environment agency website .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: weather : mist clearing brighter later
text: icy mist and fog clearing to leave a drier and brighter friday with highs of 9c ( 48f ) .
here 's the full regional forecast .
visit bbc weather for more .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: headlines : rubbish fires on increase in peterborough flood warnings in place
text: the news on friday morning :
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: welcome to bbc cambridgeshire live
text: good morning and welcome to cambridgeshire live .
stay with us for the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates for the county until 18:00 .
you can get involved with our live page at any time .
send us your stories and via email , facebook or twitter .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News
